comments.commentBody: why does trump believe that obama illegally wiretapped his phone?  because he fully intends to do that ( and much worse ) to those on his enemies list.  but he may not be able to get away with it while there is a free press, so that has to go.

Donald Trump is, once again, showing the world the REAL reason he's in the Oval Office. It's not about 'making America great again'. How could a failure like Donald Trump make anything great? It's not even about Hilary Clinton, since they were friends before the election. This is about the first Black President of the United States. Donald Trump (and the deplorables who support him) have never and will never get over the fact that not only was Barack Obama President of the United States, he was one of the most successful Presidents in US history.

Donald Trump thought he could waltz into the White House and simply destroy everything President Obama accomplished with a wave of his tiny hand. Trump thought that just because President Obama made it LOOK easy, it WAS easy.

This is the hardest Donald Trump has ever worked in his life and he HATES it. Meanwhile, his obsession is hanging out with REAL billionaires, going to Broadway shows and getting cheered everywhere he goes. President Obama isn't sweating Donald Trump.

Call his bluff, America! Demand proof! The more Trump's administration falls apart, the more outrageous the stunts Trump pulls to distract the American people will be. Anybody remember the REAL reason Ronald Reagan invaded Grenada? It wasn't because to save a bunch of med students.

I hope the American people realize their sons and daughters will die in whatever war Trump starts to cover his tracks. His kids will be playing golf or on safari.

The Obama administration declined to criticize Dir Comey's inflammatory letter regarding the Clinton emails. The AG recused herself from participating in the email controversy because of the likely perception of impropriety given the Bill Clinton visit on the tarmac. It appears the Obama administration was leaning backward to maintain independence of the Dept of Justice.
Now, someone thinks that the administration, ostensibly on the orders of President Obama, was listening in to conversations of Trump Inc, or, perhaps, of the campaign working in Trump Tower, or, perhaps, of checking computer contacts with either international banks or Russian officials.
It does appear that the FBI was monitoring contacts with the Russian ambassador. Is this what it's all about? An effort to make exposing contacts between Trump campaign officials and the Russians seem illegitimate? Or is it just one of those attempts to divert attention?

Proffexpert writes, "How could such a monstrous fool have been elected President?"

Winston Churchill answered this far better than I ever could, "The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter."

The emperor has no clothes. The illusion of a "presidential" Trump disappeared the instant the teleprompters were taken away. We've got a narcissistic, paranoid delusional con man sitting in the White House.

Trump's "I'm rubber and you're glue," act is getting tiresome. Now it's getting compared to McCarthy and blaming Obama of McCarthyism. He gives his supporters so much to play with by getting his news from alt-right propaganda, and clear channel entertainment media and then endorsing it, perpetuating the vicious cycle. Meanwhile the billionaires have their hand in the register and one can only guess what Putin and has planned.
You ain't seen nothing yet.

This joke of a president shouldn't slander President Obama on a 6 AM tweet and for once should just be an adult at the very least. Though some auspect he is attempting to distract for the mistakes of his team. His Presidency has been hijacked by Bannon, Sessions, and the wierdo Miller.

Trump lies, and lies, and lies then lies some more, then tells more lies after those. He's like the Nile -- an endless river, of lies. Without thinking.

What a nightmare it must be for subordinates -- men of substance and integrity -- to report to him. He surrounds himself with sycophants like a Medieval king (what he is in his own mind) but there are still a few who must handle him with kid gloves lest he destroys the world.

Trump often flouted the laws of the land with impunity before being elected president. Now, he willfully creates an alternate reality with "alternative facts" on the spur of the moment to fit his needs, a stream-of-consciousness fantasy that cloaks himself from the consequences of his wrong-doings. At some subconscious level he must know that he is wrong or doing wrong, otherwise, he wouldn't do it. But its tactical. And he does it, in part, because he believes that it doesn't matter. He is never in the wrong, or doing wrong, because right and wrong (moral values) don't exist. Only winning and losing exist.

“I could stand in the middle of Fifth Avenue and shoot somebody and I wouldn’t lose any voters", he said. Parse that sentence. Look beyond its absurdities. Shooting someone anywhere for any reason would be a violent act, probably wrongful and criminal depending on the circumstances. But he ignores that. For him, that doesn't exist. He could order a nuclear attack on Iran that kills millions without justification or provocation by Iran the same way.
Trump makes you want to hate Hillary Clinton even more......for not winning!

WMK...when you read articles like this, you should try to absorb the content of the article instead of just demonstrating your practiced Pavlovian 'pro-life' reflex.

Mr. Kristof discusses the critical importance of sex education, sex preparedness, cheap/free (non-abortive) modern contraception, and healthcare access for women.

All of these things prevent pregnancies and prevent abortions; you should be thrilled about these family planning clinics providing these services....and yet there you are, praying to 'end abortion' when you should be contributing to Planned Parenthood, supporting public sex education, supporting affordable health care and affordable/free modern contraception methods, all of which are guaranteed to collapse the abortion rate AND railing against religious ignorance and 'abstinence' birth control that increases the abortion rate.

If you want to be taken seriously on the issue of preventing abortion, then you have to get serious on sex education and affordable modern contraception; you can't just show up in church and at Planned Parenthood with your head in 'pro-life-anti-abortion' sand and pray for magical salvation.

And if you really want to have state regulation of uteruses, then why not also have state regulation of the testicles that contribute to pregnancies ?

And we are not fortunate to have Vice Pastor Mike Pence imposing Christian Shariah Law and forced pregnancies on poor America women; we are cursed by his medieval, misogynistic Puritanism.

The Peace Corp did wonderful things for every one of the Americans I've known who volunteered. It seemed to produce a more mature and balanced judgment, to have spent that time so far out of their comfort zone.

I've traveled over much of the US, and our size leads to a variety that one must see to really appreciate.

I imagine a Peace Corp here at home would have the same good effects on the volunteers, whatever good they could or could not do for those they "help." Just that lesson in humility is good.

I'm glad the Peace Corp did a lot for the volunteers. I'm far more dubious as to what it did for the people it was supposed to help in other countries.

What is being suggested here? We're going to take unskilled, inexperienced, and largely untrained 18-year-olds from regions of low unemployment, and give these snot-nosed, arrogant youths jobs in areas of high unemployment. Then, when they might finally be learning how to do something useful, their year of service will end, they'll go home with a big scholarship, and many tales of grinding poverty to tell their bi-coastal brethren.

How about, instead, taking the money from that program, hiring actual grown-ups in those high unemployment areas, training them properly, and giving them permanent jobs helping their neighbors. Maybe, just maybe, those people will actually do some good, because they'll be dealing with their neighbors, not a bunch of strangers that they'll never see again.

The Peace Corp has done far more for the Peace Corp volunteers than it ever did for the countries to which those volunteers were sent. The same would be true of a year of national service. Sounds like yet another upper-middle class entitlement for the bi-coastal elite.

Americorps is supposed to be the"domestic Peace Corps."  It was preceded by VISTA,  Volunteers in Service to America.  That, too, was billed as the domestic Peace Corps.  I worked in Wilcox County, Alabama, as a VISTA volunteer in 1969-1970.  The county was at that time the tenth poorest county in the US.  The experience opened my California eyes to a world I had previously known only as a stereotype.  I ended up working another seven years in the rural South (in Georgia).  When I moved away I carried with me a deep appreciation of rural Southerners, both black and white.

Remember the War on Poverty? Despite Reagan's typically stupid remark, "We declared war on poverty, and poverty won," these programs actually did reduce poverty while they were fully funded. The problem was that the volunteers challenged local governmental and social structures that favored the wealthy, and so the programs were gradually whittled away or absorbed into other agencies.
You're assuming Messrs. McConnell, Ryan, et all, have operative consciences. I believe they do not.

No one screams about wiretaps because lies are being told about them.

Oops, Trump just let the cat out of the bag, validating the swirl of allegations and suspicions.
I don't know if the King OfJamaic Estates is crazy or not.  I do know that he lies more than anyone I've ever heard of.

I suspect that this is merely a last minute, extremly desperate excuse before the truth comes out about his ties to Russia, and he will at that point complain that the information was obtained "illegally." It must be very bad if he is THAT desperate and went that low.
Where do the parameters for telling untruths end and slander begin?

This is Trump demonstrating how to divert attention from serious allegations against him and his administration onto his much more intelligent and astute predecessor.

The man, Trump, is beyond the beyond. Whatever that may be, it's not good.

Oh, what a tangled web we weave
When first we practise to deceive!
Not only did they bug his office, they broke into the officers' mess and stole his strawberries . . .
He's seriously losing it.
I think it's time:  "LOCK HIM UP" for his own good and the nation.  The man is unfit to be president.
that train wreck is our country rumbling off the rails, these guys ain't going anywhere.

I'm starting think the only reason Trump wanted to be President is so that the taxpayers can pay for his weekly vacations to his resort Mara Lago to play golf, I think he's already spent more in this time than President Obama did in a year or two.

Can anyone imagine President Obama making such an accusation?
Actually, I doubt even Nixon would have done it.
Trump is the most dangerous, simplistic President in our history.
